moves.2... c5: Black plays symmetrically, trying to aggravate White by simply copying his moves.
moves.4. d4: Even here, Black could play 4. ... d5!? after which 5. cxd5 Nxd5 6. dxc5 e6 is okay for Black.
moves.4... cxd4 5. Nxd4 g6: Black invites the Open Sicilian, Maroczy Bind Variation.
moves.7. Be2 Bg7 8. Be3 O-O 9. Nc2: White should castle or play Qd2, preparing 0-0-0.
moves.9... Nd7 10. Qd2 Re8: so that Bh6 can be met by Bh8
moves.13. f3 a6 14. O-O Nb4 15. Nd5: Apparently this looks winning for White, but Black has a surprise sacrifice.
moves.15... Nxd5 16. Qxa5 Nxe3 17. Rfe1 Bd4: Black has two pieces and lots of play for the Queen.
moves.19. Qd2 e5 20. Nc2 Nxc2 21. Rxc2: Now the Black bishop will be very hard to remove.
moves.21... Ba4: Provoking b3, which further weakens the dark squares.
moves.25. Rcd1 Ref8 26. Bd3 h6: Black should have played ... f5 immediately.
